data.question: A deadlock exists in the system if and only if the wait for graph :
data.op2: has a path from first node to last node

data.question: Data processing cycle consists of :
data.op2: Input cycle, output cycle, storage and processing cycle

data.question: Which of the following is not a proper state of transaction ?

Which commands are used to control which users have which privilege over which objects ?
When a deadlock is detected the recovery is normally accomplished by :
Which is not a desirable property of a transaction ?

Transaction Throughput is :
data.op1: Elapsed Time between submitting a transaction and receiving a transaction.
data.op2: Average no. of transaction processed per second.
data.op3: No. of resources used by a transaction.

data.question: A transaction performs on the isolation level of the Read Uncommitted if :
One common approach of preventing deadlocks, before beginning an update is :
data.op4: lock all the rows and/or table

data.question: Media recovery refers to recovering database :
data.op2: after some individual transaction has failed.
data.op3: after database has been physically damaged.

data.question: Which one is true statement ?
data.op1: With finer degree of granularity of locking a high degree of concurrency is possible.
data.op3: Locking cannot take place at level.
data.op4: An exclusive lock on data item X is granted even if a shared lock in already held on X.

data.question: Assume transaction A holds a share lock R. If a transaction B also requests for a shared lock on R.
data.op1: it will result in deadlock situation.
data.op4: it will be granted as soon as it is released by A.

data.question: A race condition occurs when :
data.op1: Two concurrent activities interact to cause a processing error.
data.op2: Two users of the DMS are interacting with different files at the same time.

data.question: In multiuser database, if two users wish to update the same record at the same time, they are prevented by doing so by
One of the following steps is not involved in processing a query :
Which one of the following describes the timestamp-based protocols correctly ?
data.op1: This protocol requires that each transaction issue lock and unlock requests in two phases.
data.op2: This protocol employs only exclusive locks.
data.op3: This protocol selects an ordering among transaction in advance.

data.question: Which of the following can enhance database system throughput ?
data.op1: Database system throughput can be enhanced by locking the smallest sized objects possible.
data.op2: Database system throughput can be enhanced by reducing the time that transaction that hold locks.
data.op3: Database system throughput can be enhanced by reducing the hot spots (frequently accessed and modified database objects).
data.op4: Increasing the main memory capacity can enhance database system throughput.

data.question: A statement that is executed automatically by the system as a side effect of a modification to the database is known as :
An audit trail :
data.op1: Can be used to restore lost information
data.op2: is used to make backup copies
data.op3: is the recovered history of operations performed on a file

data.question: Assume transaction A holds a shared lock R. If transaction B also requests for a shared lock on R.
data.op1: it will result in a deadlock situation
